episodes.title: EP22: Conscious Christmas – How to Celebrate After Awakening
episodes.description:
What do you do with Christmas when you’ve left church—but still love the season? 
If you’ve ever wondered how to redeem Christmas without going back to religious performance, this conversation offers permission, language, and ideas for creating a conscious Christmas that actually feels like you.

In this episode of the Unchurching Podcast, Clint and Rachelle talk honestly about how confusing and guilt-laden Christmas can feel after deconstruction: Do you still “make it about Jesus”? What do you do with the nostalgia, the carols, the services, and the pressure to celebrate?

They explore the deeper history of Christmas—from pagan solstice festivals to the surprising lore behind Santa, stockings, and gifts under the tree—and how that history can actually free you from religious obligation. You may be surprised, we were!

They reframe Jesus through an awakened lens: Instead of centering a distant God or a baby “born to die,” they invite you to see Christmas as an inner event—honoring your own awakening, inner guidance, humility, and soul gifts.

They also introduce a playful new “bumper sticker” segment, where they take familiar Christian phrases and gently reinterpret them through a lens of consciousness, freedom, and light.

✨ Christmas can be about light within, not religious obligation.
✨ Jesus shows us our own divinity, not our depravity.
✨ You’re allowed to rewrite your traditions in a way that feels true.

🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.
📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast

⏱️ Chapters

00:00 – Welcome & the chaos of Clint’s Christmas décor
01:20 – When Christmas feels strange after leaving church
02:45 – Missing old traditions & asking: “What do we do with this now?”
04:30 – Was Christmas ever really about Jesus’ birthday?
06:20 – Solstice, Yule, and the return of the light
09:30 – How the church absorbed existing midwinter traditions

49:20 – The “star,” intuition, and inner guidance

51:20 – Gifts, soul gifts, and what we really bring to each other
52:30 – Making Christmas an inner event instead of a religious obligation
54:20 – Final reflections & a conscious Christmas blessing

episodes.title: EP21: Clint's Physical Awakening – When Healing Takes Everything You Have
episodes.description: In this powerful and deeply vulnerable first video episode, Clint opens up about the past 11 months that completely changed his life — the unraveling of identity, the collapse of the body, and the slow, sacred rebirth that followed. From full-body spasms and sleepless nights to moments of surrender and spiritual awakening, this is the raw and unfiltered story behind Clint’s physical awakening — what it really looks like when the body becomes the teacher. Alongside Rachelle, he shares the fear, humor, humility, and transformation that unfolded as his body pulled him into consciousness, breaking through the illusion of control and teaching him what true healing really means. ✨ Awakening through illness — when your body becomes your guide ✨ Releasing trauma stored in the fascia and nervous system ✨ From control and striving to surrender and presence ––– 🎧 Listen on all platforms → Listen Now 🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening. 📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast 🌐 Learn more or book mentorship: unchurchingpodcast.com ⏱️ Chapters 00:00 – Welcome to Our First Video Episode 01:00 – Why We’re Sharing This Story Now 03:00 – The Impossible Year: 11 Months of Awakening 07:00 – The Night It All Began 10:00 – Spasms, ER Visits & Confusion 14:00 – The Wellness Center & Black Blood Revelation 17:00 – Heavy Metals, Trauma, and the Turning Point 22:00 – When the Body Becomes the Teacher 26:00 – From Startup Burnout to Breakdown 33:00 – Stress, Responsibility & Survival Mode 40:00 – The Gun Moment: When Life Feels Too Heavy 47:00 – Finding Meaning in the Darkness 51:00 – Meeting the Shaman – The Day of Rebirth 56:00 – Learning to Rest, Release, and Receive 01:03:00 – Energy Healing, Self-Talk & Speaking to the Body 01:10:00 – Fascia, Memory & Generational Trauma 01:16:00 – Nervous System Rewiring & Safety 01:23:00 – Healing Without the System: Presence Over Pills 01:29:00 – Grieving the Life You Lost 01:35:00 – Releasing the Old Self & Integrating the New 01:44:00 – Near-Death & the Rebirth Experience 01:52:00 – Lessons from the Edge of Life 01:55:00 – Living From Presence, Not Performance 01:57:00 – Gratitude, Love, and Closing Reflections

episodes.title: EP20: The Awakening Body – When Healing Feels Like Falling Apart
episodes.description: In this deeply personal and eye-opening episode, Clint and Rachelle open up about what happens when spiritual awakening takes over the body. From nerve pain and insomnia to emotional waves and physical recalibration, they explore how awakening isn’t just a state of mind — it’s a full-body transformation. They discuss how trauma lives in the fascia, why the nervous system holds the key to healing, and how to tell the difference between illness and awakening. With honesty, humor, and compassion, they share their lived experience of physical awakening — the confusion, the beauty, and the unshakable trust that the body knows what it’s doing. ✨ Your body isn’t betraying you — it’s leading you home ✨ Pain isn’t punishment — it’s communication ✨ You’re not falling apart — you’re waking up ––– 🎧 Listen on all platforms → Listen Now 🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening. 📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast 🌐 Learn more or book mentorship: unchurchingpodcast.com ⏱️ Chapters 00:00 – Welcome & Disclaimer 02:30 – The Misunderstanding of Physical Awakening 06:00 – Diagnosed or Awakening? 09:30 – The Emotional Toll & Trusting Intuition 13:00 – Awakening Through the Body 17:00 – Energy, Fascia & the Nervous System 22:00 – Survival Mode & the Fight-or-Flight Trap 28:00 – Childhood Trauma & Emotional Imprints 33:00 – Releasing Stored Pain & Triggers 38:00 – When Old Wounds Resurface 44:00 – Physical Symptoms of Awakening 50:00 – Digestion, Hormones & Recalibration 55:00 – The Nervous System as Messenger 01:00:00 – Speaking to the Body & Rewiring Safety 01:05:00 – Integration & The New Body 01:08:00 – Final Reflections: You’re Not Broken

episodes.title: EP18: The Cult Condition (Pt2) - Reclaiming Your Autonomy
episodes.description:
If last week was about seeing the pattern, this week is about breaking it. 


In Part 2 of The Cult Condition, Clint and Rachelle move from awareness to action — exploring how to heal, rebuild trust, and reclaim your autonomy after leaving control-based systems. They unpack how to find healthy community, rebuild faith without dogma, and rediscover freedom as responsibility — not rebellion.


Through personal stories and practical guidance, they share how to re-pattern your nervous system, restore your inner voice, and rebuild trust after manipulation. You’ll learn how to choose from love instead of fear, cultivate conscious community, and redefine what faith and belonging mean after leaving systems of control.


✨ Freedom isn’t rebellion — it’s responsibility.
✨ You don’t have to reject everything you loved, only the fear that came with it.
✨ You haven’t lost God — you’ve remembered love.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast (https://www.instagram.com/unchurchingpodcast/) 
🌐 Learn more or book mentorship: unchurchingpodcast.com (https://www.unchurchingpodcast.com)

episodes.title: EP17: The Cult Condition (Pt1) - How Good People Get Trapped in Systems of Control
episodes.description: In this provocative and insightful episode, Clint and Rachelle dive headfirst into a question many have thought but few have said aloud: Is the Church a cult? Prompted by a listener’s message about cult definitions, they explore the overlap between religious systems and cultish behavior — not to condemn, but to awaken awareness. This isn’t a “church-bashing” episode; it’s an honest look at how control can quietly replace curiosity in any human system — from religion to politics to wellness and even awakening spaces. Together, they unpack the key markers of cultish dynamics — fear-based loyalty, unquestioned leadership, behavior control, and “us vs. them” thinking — while sharing their own experiences navigating these patterns. They discuss why good people get caught in manipulative systems, how belonging and certainty can be used against us, and why awareness, not anger, is the path to freedom. ✨ Cults aren’t defined by beliefs — they’re defined by behavior. ✨ Awareness, not anger, is what frees us. ✨ True community creates freedom, not conformity. ––– 🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening. 📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast 🌐 Learn more or book mentorship: unchurchingpodcast.com ⏱️ Chapters 00:00 – Welcome & Listener Inspiration 01:00 – Why We’re Talking About This 02:45 – Defining Cult Behavior (Without the Anger) 04:30 – Cultish Patterns Beyond Religion 06:00 – The Cult in All of Us 07:45 – Belonging, Control, and Sovereignty 09:30 – What Defines a Cult? 11:15 – The Anointed Leader: Unquestioned Devotion 14:30 – Fear-Based Loyalty & “Us vs. Them” Thinking 17:00 – Control of Thoughts and Behavior 19:00 – Doctrine Over the Person 20:55 – Community vs. Control 23:00 – Why We Stay: Belonging, Certainty, Purpose 25:45 – The Human Need for Safety & Meaning 28:00 – When Systems Use Those Needs Against You 31:00 – The Psychology of Cult Behavior 33:15 – Fear of Doubt & Suppression of Curiosity 35:30 – Emotional Control and Behavior Policing 38:00 – Why Good People Get Trapped 41:00 – Authority Obedience and Group Pressure 43:30 – Cognitive Dissonance: Defending the System 46:30 – Belonging and Manipulation 48:30 – Unity Consciousness and True Belonging 53:00 – Cultish Patterns in Awakening Spaces 56:00 – Spiritual Hierarchies and “Next-Level” Selling 58:00 – The Myth of the Trigger and Spiritual Ego 01:00:30 – Awareness, Not Anger, Brings Freedom 01:02:00 – Reflection Questions for Self-Awareness 01:04:30 – Awakening: From Belonging to Love, Not Control 01:06:00 – Outro & What’s Coming in Part 2

episodes.title: EP16: Learning to Know Nothing - The Paradox of Awakening
episodes.description:
In this intimate solo episode, Rachelle explores one of awakening’s most liberating paradoxes: learning to “know nothing.” 


She shares how leaving religious certainty opened a wider world of curiosity, peace, and genuine learning—starting with unlearning. From the ego’s addiction to being right, to the freedom of saying “I don’t know,” Rachelle reframes wisdom as a posture, not a pile of facts. She unpacks the difference between religion’s safety-in-answers and awakening’s freedom-in-openness, and introduces a powerful law from her studies: you don’t understand your way into peace—you peace your way into understanding.


You’ll also hear about staying non-judgmental while exploring new ideas, choosing your “teacher” (ego vs. peace), why innocence and curiosity matter, and how free will and openness shape spiritual experience. She closes with a grounding affirmation to carry into your week.


✨ Key ideas:

  •  
     
     Unlearning before learning: why dismantling certainty comes first
     
  •  
     
     Ego vs. peace as teachers: choosing curiosity over defense
     
  •  
     
     “Peace first, then understanding”: practicing the paradox in daily life
     

–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast
🌐 Learn more or book mentorship: unchurchingpodcast.com

episodes.title: EP15: Guilt Is Not Real - Healing What You Were Taught To Carry
episodes.description:
In this powerful and emotional conversation, Clint and Rachelle explore how guilt became one of religion’s most effective tools of control—and how awakening reveals that it was never real in the first place. 


A listener comment quoting “The wages of sin is death” sparks a deep dive into how guilt has been weaponized through doctrine, fear, and manipulation. They unpack how guilt keeps people small, separate, and afraid, and how it shows up even after leaving organized religion—through social conditioning, judgment, and self-punishment.


Through vulnerability and laughter, they reframe guilt not as divine justice, but as the illusion of separation from love. They reinterpret sin as forgetfulness, death as the loss of awareness, and salvation as the remembrance of who you already are.


✨ Guilt isn’t proof of sin—it’s proof of separation.
✨ You don’t need to earn forgiveness—only awareness.
✨ When guilt dissolves, love takes its place.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast (https://www.instagram.com/unchurchingpodcast/) 
🌐 Learn more or book mentorship: unchurchingpodcast.com (https://www.unchurchingpodcast.com)

episodes.title: EP14: Finding Your Life's Purpose - No Pressure, Just Presence
episodes.description:
If you’ve ever asked, “What’s God’s plan for my life?” — this one’s for you. 

In this heartfelt and illuminating episode, Clint and Rachelle unpack one of the biggest questions people face after leaving organized religion: what is my purpose now?

They explore how the church framed purpose as a heavy, high-stakes assignment — something to earn, perform, or prove — and how awakening transforms it into something entirely different: a remembering. Purpose isn’t about chasing a divine blueprint; it’s about aligning with presence, awareness, and love.

Together they break down how religious systems created pressure around “calling,” how Jeremiah 29:11 has been misused to individualize purpose, and how awakening redefines it as a collective unfolding of consciousness. They also share stories of integrating old skills into new expressions, healing the fear of “missing God’s will,” and discovering that the only plan worth finding is the one already alive within you.

✨ Purpose isn’t a mission to achieve — it’s a state of being.
✨ The plan isn’t something you chase — it’s something you allow.
✨ When you remember who you are, purpose naturally flows through you.

–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.

📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast

🌐 Learn more or book mentorship: unchurchingpodcast.com

episodes.title: EP13: Unplugged 2 - Couples Awakening, Satanism & Separation from God
episodes.description:
Can you really leave God… or just the system that claimed to own connection to the divine? 

In this candid Unplugged conversation, Clint and Rachelle share openly about their journey of awakening as a couple—what it’s like to grow at different paces, support each other through shadow work, and redefine faith beyond religion. They reflect on their years in the church, the evolving meaning of success and provision, and how true connection to Source doesn’t depend on belonging to an institution.

The conversation also dives into listener questions about Satanism, demons, and Halloween, unpacking fear-based teachings and exploring how these concepts often mirror our own shadows and unhealed trauma. Through laughter, honesty, and spiritual insight, Clint and Rachelle reframe these once-taboo topics in the light of awakening.

They close with a powerful truth: nothing can separate you from God.

✨ Awakening looks different for everyone—even in a relationship.
✨ Old beliefs about Satan, demons, and separation point back to the ego and the body’s unprocessed pain.
✨ Leaving church doesn’t mean losing God—it might mean finding real connection for the first time.

–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.

📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast

🌐 Learn more or book a session: unchurchingpodcast.com

episodes.title: EP12: Awakening Adam – How Humans Fell Asleep
episodes.description:
What if Adam’s “deep sleep” was more than a story—what if it was a metaphor for humanity’s unconsciousness? 


In this episode of the Unchurching Podcast, Clint and Rachelle explore the journey of awakening and consciousness through the lens of Adam’s deep sleep in the Garden of Eden. They discuss how ego, trauma, and cultural conditioning keep us in patterns of unconscious living—and how awakening is about remembering our true connection to Source.


Together, they reflect on the illusion of separation, the role of the ego, and the importance of self-awareness, presence, and shadow work in the awakening journey.


✨ People are awakening and breaking out of conditioned molds.
✨ Separation from Source is an illusion—we are all interconnected.
✨ Awareness is the first step toward freedom and awakening.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast (https://www.instagram.com/unchurchingpodcast/)

episodes.title: EP11: Holy Ghosted – Awakening and the Holy Spirit
episodes.description:
What if the Holy Spirit was never outside of you—but always the voice of remembrance within? 


In this episode of the Unchurching Podcast, Clint and Rachelle dive into the multifaceted nature of the Holy Spirit. They share personal experiences and cultural perspectives, explore how different denominations frame the Spirit, and discuss the neurobiology of worship and collective experience.


This conversation reframes the Holy Spirit—not as a distant force to be invited in, but as the inner guide, comforter, and reminder of oneness with God and with ourselves. Along the way, they unpack themes of fear, control, atonement, and mystical connection, ultimately pointing to the Spirit as a voice of awakening.


✨ You are not separate from God.
✨ The Spirit reminds us of who we truly are.
✨ Awakening is a journey of connection, not fear.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast (https://www.instagram.com/unchurchingpodcast/)

episodes.title: EP10: Tools for Remembering – Breathwork, Meditation & Grounding with Justin Lovato
episodes.description:
Awakening is not about becoming something new—it’s about remembering who you are. 


In this episode of the Unchurching Podcast, Clint and Rachelle sit down with Justin Lovato, mentor and guide, for a conversation on the tools that support awakening. Together they explore how breathwork, meditation, and grounding help us reconnect with presence, navigate fear, and step into love.


Justin shares personal insights from his own journey, emphasizing that awakening is a process of remembering rather than striving. They discuss the challenges of coming out of traditional religion, the importance of holding space, and the practical ways we can anchor into healing and transformation each day.


✨ Remembering is the heart of awakening.
✨ Breath, presence, and grounding are the tools.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.

episodes.title: Ep9: Fear, Doubt, and the Devil - How Religion Uses Control
episodes.description:
Fear is one of the most powerful tools religion has ever used. 


In this episode of the Unchurching podcast, Clint and Rachelle take a raw look at how fear, doubt, and the devil have been woven into church life as mechanisms of control. They share personal stories of living under judgment, explore the historical roots of fear in Christianity, and unpack the contradictions between theology and love. 


This conversation is both deeply personal and deeply practical: how fear manifests in our bodies, how it affects our mental health, and how awakening is the process of remembering who we truly are. Listeners are invited to question inherited beliefs, embrace authenticity, and discover that real community is built not on fear, but on love and connection. 


✨ Fear is baked into theology.
✨ You are free to question.
✨ Constructed fear can be deconstructed.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast (https://www.instagram.com/unchurchingpodcast/) 
🌐 Book a free 15-minute discovery call to explore mentorship with Clint at unchurchingpodcast.com (www.unchurchingpodcast.com)

episodes.title: Ep8: David Trotter Interview - Two Former Church Leaders Journey Through Awakening
episodes.description:
What happens when church leaders awaken—and choose authenticity over performance? 


In this episode of the Unchurching podcast, Clint sits down with David Trotter, former pastor and founder of Awakened magazine, for an honest conversation about life after church leadership and the expansive journey of awakening.


Together, they reflect on leaving behind old belief systems, embracing unconditional love, and discovering the transformative power of curiosity and plant medicine. David shares the struggles many leaders face behind closed doors, the pressure of religious performance, and how healing and freedom begin with authentic conversations.


This dialogue between two former church leaders is an invitation into safety, love, and a broader spirituality—one that goes far beyond the confines of religious structures.


✨ Curiosity is a gift from God.
✨ You can try on new beliefs for a day.
✨ You’re safe, and you’re loved.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast (https://www.instagram.com/unchurchingpodcast/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)

episodes.title: EP7: Unchurching Unplugged 1 – Lessons We’ve Learned So Far
episodes.description:
Sometimes the best way forward is to pause and share the journey so far. 


In this special Unchurching Unplugged episode, Clint and Rachelle step back from structured themes and have an open conversation about what they’ve learned on their awakening path. They express gratitude for listeners, share their experiences moving across countries, and reflect on the challenges and growth that shaped them. 


This is a candid look at how ego shows up in the spiritual journey, how prayer can be redefined as connection rather than duty, and how empowerment comes from realizing your own inner power. They also talk about the freedom of embracing new possibilities, and the importance of community support in times of transformation. 


✨ Everything is working in your favor.
✨ You’re not alone in this journey.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast (https://www.instagram.com/unchurchingpodcast/)

episodes.title: Ep6: The Soul Realm - Understanding Your Life Journey
episodes.description:
What if understanding the afterlife could change the way you live this one? 


In this episode of the Unchurching podcast, Clint and Rachelle explore the soul realm—what it is, what happens there, and how it shapes your life journey. They share personal transformative experiences, insights from hypnosis and past life regression, and reflections on the soul’s purpose and interconnectedness with the body. 


You’ll hear about the role of free will, the deep bonds of soulmates and soul groups, and how suffering can be a catalyst for growth. This is a conversation about remembering who you really are, embracing your unique path, and trusting the process of discovery. 


✨ There’s no danger in discovery.
✨ You are a free will soul.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast (https://www.instagram.com/unchurchingpodcast/) 
🌐 Free Mentorship call with Clint at unchurchingpodcast.com

episodes.title: Ep5: Be Here Now - Why the Present Moment Changes Everything
episodes.description:
You already have the tool to become present—right now. 


In this episode of the Unchurching podcast, Clint and Rachelle explore the life-changing power of present moment awareness and how it impacts awakening, emotional healing, and self-discovery. They share personal experiences and practical tools—like breath work, journaling, and gratitude—that anchor you in the now. 


This is a conversation about why we get trapped in cycles of regret over the past and fear about the future, how societal structures keep us distracted, and how reconnecting with your true self in the present is the key to spiritual growth. 


✨ The secret is here in the present.
✨ Stillness is where connection begins.
✨ You need to discover who you are.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast (https://www.instagram.com/unchurchingpodcast/) 
🌐 Mentorship with Clint at unchurchingpodcast.com

episodes.title: Ep4: Resurrection & Virgin Birth - Do They Really Prove Divinity?
episodes.description:
What if the resurrection and virgin birth were never meant to be taken literally? 


In this episode of the Unchurching podcast, Clint and Rachelle explore how some of Christianity’s most sacred stories—like the resurrection and the virgin birth—might actually point us inward, not upward. They examine how awakening often comes by reinterpreting belief systems that once felt unshakable. 


This is a conversation about Jesus, Mary, the soul realm, and transformation. Not as distant theological concepts, but as living metaphors for the divine potential within you. Because sometimes, the real resurrection isn’t about rising from the grave—it’s about rising from the conditioning that kept you asleep. 


✨ Awakening is a resurrection.
✨ Love is stronger than death.
✨ You are a vessel for the divine.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is a podcast for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast (https://www.instagram.com/unchurchingpodcast/) 
🌐 Learn more about mentorship with Clint at unchurchingpodcast.com

episodes.title: Ep3: Jesus & Salvation - Did He Really Come To Save You?
episodes.description:
What if Jesus didn’t come to save you—but to awaken you? 

In this episode of the Unchurching Podcast, Clint and Rachelle unpack the doctrine of salvation and the exclusivity of Christianity. They ask tough questions about Jesus’ purpose, challenge traditional interpretations of the virgin birth and resurrection, and explore the concept of Christ consciousness.

This conversation reimagines salvation as awakening, inviting listeners to see the kingdom of heaven as something already within. It’s a radical reframing of Jesus—not as a distant savior, but as a mirror of our own divinity.

–––
👉 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast

👉 Book a free 15-minute discovery call to explore mentorship with Clint: unchurchingpodcast.com

–––

episodes.title: Ep2: Awakening - When You Start To Wonder
episodes.description:
Why is wanting to find truth a bad thing? 


In this second episode of the Unchurching podcast, Clint and Rachelle Davis dive into the emotional, liberating, and often disorienting process of awakening after leaving organized religion. They share personal stories of questioning long-held beliefs, navigating grief and anger, and learning to trust themselves in the journey of self-discovery. 


You’ll hear raw reflections on how authority in faith can become control, how identity and community are shaken in the unraveling, and how awakening is not just about leaving—but about remembering who you are. 


This episode offers a powerful invitation to reclaim your spiritual sovereignty, and embrace the questions that lead to freedom. 






✨ You’re not alone in this.
✨ You’re not broken. You’re awakening.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is more than a podcast—it’s a space for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.


📲 Follow us on Instagram: @unchurchingpodcast (https://www.instagram.com/unchurchingpodcast/)

episodes.title: Ep1: "Leaving" - When Church No Longer Fits
episodes.description:
Because when it all starts to fall apart, you need to know you’re not alone. 


In this first episode of the Unchurching podcast, Clint and Rachelle Davis open the door to a new kind of spiritual conversation. They share the deeply personal journey of leaving traditional church structures and stepping into an awakening of consciousness, identity, and purpose.


You’ll hear stories of grief, freedom, and redefinition as they explore what happens when the beliefs, systems, and communities that once defined your world no longer fit. They also share powerful statistics about the decline of church attendance and why so many people are walking away—not to reject spirituality, but to rediscover it.


This is your invitation to step beyond performance-based religion and into something deeper, wilder, and more true.


✨ You're not broken. You're awakening.
✨ There’s so much more.


–––
🌀 Unchurching is more than a podcast—it’s a space for the spiritually curious, the deconstructing, and the awakening.
